item.title: The Paris Agreement: Foundation of Modern Climate Policy
item.description: The Paris Agreement, adopted on December 12, 2015, is a landmark international accord aimed at combating climate change and its effects. To date, it brings together 195 nations with the goal of limiting global warming to well below 2 degrees Celsius above pre-industrial levels, while pursuing efforts to limit the increase to 1.5 degrees Celsius. Key components of the agreement include: Nationally Determined Contributions (NDCs): Each country sets its own climate action plans and targets, which are to be updated every five years to reflect greater ambition.
